thread.title: Lions' Larry Warford could boost offensive line by returning today
thread.title_full: Lions' Larry Warford could boost offensive line by returning today

author: freep.com
title: Lions' Larry Warford could boost offensive line by returning today
text:
MORE The Detroit Lions' struggling offensive line could get a boost today from the return of right guard Larry Warford.
Warford, who has missed three of the five games this year with a high ankle sprain he originally suffered in an August exhibition game, is listed as probable, though it remains unclear if he'll start.
Left guard Manny Ramirez has played right guard in Warford's absence, and rookie Laken Tomlinson has started the past two weeks at left guard.
"He's a guy that packs a punch in there," coach Jim Caldwell said of Warford. "He's a good size guy that has power, and he's got experience, and he's also certainly played against a lot of the guys who we're going to play against here in the future. So I think he adds just a little bit more girth in there and a little bit more experience as well."
Warford struggled in his first start, a Week 2 loss to the Minnesota Vikings, then aggravated his ankle and left early the next week against the Denver Broncos.
Tomlinson has shown steady improvement the past five weeks, but the line has been the weakest link of the underachieving offense.
Caldwell blamed Warford's injury for his poor play earlier this year, and he said the third-year blocker's experience should help the running game get going up front.
"He hasn't been completely capable of functioning the way he certainly has been able to perform previously, and much of that was due to his injury," Caldwell said.
